alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 10:53PM PDT until August 21 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 200 AM PDT. * At 1053 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain continuing across northeast San Bernardino County. Between 0.75 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of washings, low-water crossings, poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The York Fire burn scar, Cima, Kelso, Mitchell Caverns, Baker, Needles, Mid Hills Campground, Mountain Pass, Hole In The Wall Campground, Black Canyon Equestrian Campground, Nipton And Ivanpah Roads, Nipton, Essex, Dumont Dunes, Sr 127 Near Dumont Dunes, Tecopa, Highway 95 And I-40 and Mohave Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
